Blog.post: The Charlotte Bobcats held their expansion draft a little while ago, and I have yet to write a blurb about it yet. Desmond Furgeson was the only Portland Trail Blazer selected by the Bobcats. The surprise to me was that Ruben Patterson was left unprotected. What surprised me further was the fact that Charlotte did not select him. he is a decent player that provides instant energy and helps livin up the game. The only explanations I could think of is that (1) They don't want to take his contract, which may be a lot for an expansion team or (2) They were turned off by some of his character issues and the qualoty of his personality. I think the Bobcats will be in a world of hurt for a few years, but then again that is expected for an expansioon team....

Am I the only one who would be very mad at the Blazers if they got rid of Theo Ratliff? After watching the part of the season he played in Portland, I think he is a must-have for the next season. If he can stay healthy he provides a dominate force in the lane to keep out pesky people driving to the basket. Forcing the opposing team to shoot from the outsides can prove invaluable to the team's success, and getting rid of the league leading shot blocker would be a major mistake, in my opinion. Leave any comments if you have an objection.

Most of you have probably heard about a possible trade in the works, involving T-Mac and Steve Francis, along witha few other players. I think this trade would be beneficial on both sides. Francis is a good overall player who could help with the troubled Magic, and maybe work with Howard. T-Mac simply wants a change and may have a renewed work ethic in a new enviroment. This is not the only major trade rumor. Names are being thrown around like Shaq, and these trades would seriously shake up the league. Kobe Bryant may be looking at other teams, being as he is a free agent, and Phil Jackson is not returning, I'm not sure if we will recognize the 04-05 Lakers, but maybe thats a good thing....

Hello everybody! This blog is dedicated to discussions and news about the Portland Trail Blazers. Obviously right now it is the offseason, so posts may not come to often, and may include news about other teams around the NBA. The NBA Draft just took a place a few days ago, and I am not very happy with the picks made by the Blazers. Telfair, selected at 13, is a young kid who shows a lot of raw skill, and could end up being one of the leagues premiere point gaurds, but the problem is the Blazers selecting him so high in the draft, when he will most likely take several years to fully be ready to run the team. I think the best bet would have been t take a more prepared player at 13, then waited and hope Telfair was availible at either 22 or 23, both picks of which belonged to the Blazers. Right now it is hard to tell, but come the regular season, I hope this guy can start playing at least a minimal amount, more then the other work in prgress, Travis Outlaw, does.

Most people know that my favorite NBA team is the Portland Trail Blazers, and I have a few wqords about the draft that recently took place. First of which is the 13th pick of Sebastian Telfair. This pick could possibly have potential, however they could have missed out by not selecting Jameer Nelson. I think Nelson is more prepared, and could make more of an instant impact. However I also feel Telfair has incredible raw talent and in a little bit of time could be become a premiere point gaurd in the league. His passing skills definately provide some entertainment. The two Russian players acquired by the Blazers will definately be interesting. I am only hoping they were not selected just as a publicity stunt, howver i have never seen them play so i do not know. All i know is it is rumored they have enough talent to play almost immediatly, however the Blazers will have to buy out their contracts with the Russian team they are currently a part of, which seems relatively cheap compared to the NBA salaries. The final pick of the Blazers was a late draft pick, not really intended for the near future. Possibly the height alone will prove him useful in due time. This offseason will probably hold many big changes, most espicially around the rest of the league, and next year will be quite the experiment.
